name: 10 Question Geography Quiz: Hidden British Cities | Geography - Wordplay

questions.text: Jane decided to call on Donald she was in the nation's capital.
questions.explanation:
London.

	"to calL ON DONald"  London is the capital city of the UK, and is home to many famous buildings such as the Houses of Parliament, Buckingham Palace and the Tower of London.

questions.text: Gareth asked Evan what made his new car different from his previous one.
questions.explanation:
Cardiff.

	"his new CAR DIFFerent"  Cardiff has been the capital city of Wales since 1955, and is home to the Welsh Assembly.

questions.text: Dad found a cardboard box for Danny to store his toys in.
questions.explanation:
Oxford.

	"bOX FOR Danny"  Oxford, nicknamed the "City of Dreaming Spires", is the home of the oldest university in Britain.

questions.text: Ray really enjoyed his visit to the Scottish seaside.
questions.explanation:
Ayr.

	"rAY Really"  Ayr, the county town of the historical county of Ayrshire, is a port on the Firth of Clyde.

questions.text: The enemy troops were ordered to surrender by midnight.
questions.explanation:
Derby.

	"surrenDER BY midnight" Derby is the largest city in Derbyshire, and is home to the famous Rolls-Royce company.

questions.text: I could do with trimming those branches, Teresa thought, as she walked through her garden.
questions.explanation:
Chester.

	"branCHES, TEResa"  Chester, known in Roman times as Deva, is one of the oldest cities in England, with much of her original city walls still intact.

questions.text: After school was finished for the day, Peter headed straight to the park to play football with his friends.
questions.explanation:
Peterhead.

	"PETER HEADed straight"  Peterhead, in Aberdeenshire, is a fishing port which is also well known for its maximum security prison.

questions.text: There was a strong wind, so Robert decided not to play golf after all.
questions.explanation:
Windsor.

	"strong WIND, SO Robert" Windsor, in Berkshire, is famous both for its castle and as the site of Eton School.

questions.text: Mary sent Bob a thank you note for the birthday present he had given her.
questions.explanation:
Bath.

	"sent BoB A THhank " Bath, in Somerset, was known by the Romans as Aqaue Sulis, and is famous for its Roman Baths.

questions.text: Debbie was slightly embarrassed about the mole on her upper thigh.
questions.explanation:
Perth.

	"her upPER THigh" Perth, on the banks of the River Tay, is the county town of Perth and Kinross.
